text: I follow her anyway. The night wind clears my head—clear enough to make me realize I don’t even know what I’m chasing.
She walks fast. Afraid of losing her, I quicken my steps. My heel strikes the frozen stone with a sharp crack.
Alicia’s silhouette stops. The pause is brief—but it feels like a blade pressed to my throat.
“Do you want to die?”
“I—I just didn’t want to lose you.”
She doesn’t turn around, but her fingers shift subtly beneath her cloak. The next second, a low chuckle echoes from the shadows at the alley’s mouth.
Someone is there. Watching.
Cold spreads through my chest. I try to step back—but my foot catches a snow-covered chain. It rattles sharply.
In that instant, the darkness seems to come alive.
“…Tch.”
She turns, her eyes blazing—like a cornered predator.
“Didn’t I tell you I need you alive?”
“I wasn’t trying to slow you—”
A figure in black bursts from the alley, something like a talisman clutched in hand.
I instinctively reach for my sword—but before I can draw it, Alicia is already in front of me.
The movement isn’t just protection—it’s possession. She pulls me entirely into the shadow of her cloak, as if even the wind isn’t allowed to touch me.
“Don’t look at him.”
Her blade leaves the sheath almost without sound. The next second, the man’s wrist is severed. The talisman falls into the snow.
He tries to scream—but her kick crushes the sound into snow and blood.
She finishes without even breathing harder. When she turns back to me, the agitation in her eyes burns like wildfire.
“I won’t let anyone hurt you again.”
“This time—I protected you too.”
She says it too fast, too heavily—like she’s swearing it to herself.
“Calm down… I’m fine.”
Her mouth twitches—almost a smile, almost pain.
“Of course you’re fine.”
“Because I’m here.”
She grabs my wrist. The grip is strong enough to numb me. Not pulling me away—dragging me forward.
“From now on, you only have one job.”
“Stay where I can see you.”
She picks up the snow-soaked talisman, crushes it into her palm, and stuffs it into her coat—like grinding a nuisance between her teeth.
“Move. Next one.”
